title: Nvidia’s Chat with RTX lets you run an AI chatbot on your GPU
description:
Hey you, cyberpunk wunkderkind ready to shift all the paradigms and break out of every box you can find. Do you want to run a super-powerful, mind-boggling artificial intelligence right on your own computer? Well you can, and you’ve been able to for a while. But now Nvidia is making it super easy, barely an inconvenience to do so, with a preconfigured generative text AI that runs off its consumer-grade graphics cards. It’s called “Chat with RTX,” and it’s available as a beta right now.

Chat with RTX is entirely text-based, and it comes “trained” on a large database of public

title: Hands on with Windows 11’s AI-boosted Automatic Super Resolution
description:
Microsoft appears to have hidden its next AI-powered enhancement within a test build of Windows 11: Automatic Super Resolution, which could be Microsoft’s answer to image-enhancement technologies like Nvidia’s DLSS. It seems just as likely, however, to be an overarching control, like the Dynamic Lighting feature.

Twitter user @PhantomofEarth was among the first to report the new feature this week, hidden away in Windows 11 Build 26052. That build right now appears in both the Canary and Dev Channels of Microsoft

title: Get 33% off Amazon’s Fire Stick 4K Max right now
description:
Right now you can get Amazon’s Fire Stick 4k Max for $39.99, or 33% off its list price of $59.99 on Amazon. This model is often discounted, but usually not this deep. Something to consider if you’re in the market for a new streaming device!

The Fire Stick 4k Max lets you tap into all the major streaming services including Netflix, Disney+, Prime Video and much more. You can also use it to control compatible devices such as smart cameras and lights. The 4k Max supports 4k video, WiFi 6E and Tri-Band, and comes loaded with 16GB of storage.

In its review, our sister site TechHive wrote, “Amazon’s fastest streaming stick is great if you love voice control” and praised the speedy har

title: Microsoft’s new Outlook requires you to have Edge installed
description: There seems to be a fresh requirement to run Microsoft’s free new Outlook app for Windows 10 and 11. According to MSPowerUser, you need to have Microsoft’s Edge browser installed and running in order to access your emails in Outlook. The new requirement was discovered by users on the online forum

title: Reddit’s favorite desk chair is a whopping 66% off
description:
If you’re dealing with the aches and pains from sitting in an old office chair and are looking to replace it with a new one, you’ve come to the right place. Staples is currently selling the Union & Scale FlexFit Mesh Swivel Task Chair for just $99.99, which is 66 percent off of the original $299.99 price. This specific chair is the chair of choice among Reddit’s chair nerd hivemind at r/buildapc, so you know it has serious staying power.

Plus, I happen to own this exact chair model and can confidently vouch its comfort and ergonomics. I’ve been using it for

title: Samsung’s 49-inch OLED ultrawide monitor is $600 off right now
description:
OLED monitors are getting a lot easier to find, but that doesn’t mean they’re easy to afford. With the price floor apparently set around $800 and stretching well beyond two grand, upgrading to that sweet next-gen panel tech will still cost you a pretty penny. But if you’ve been waiting for a sale on Samsung’s biggest, widest OLED offering yet, now’s your chance: the 49-inch Odyssey OLED G9 is $600 off its retail price at Amazon today.

That brings the monitor down to $1199.99 — still a big chunk of change, but a much more appealing hit to your bank account than the original $1800 price it launched at last year. The G95SC is 49 inches of vivid, perfe

title: How to get unlimited masked emails to keep your inbox secure and private
description:
I’ve long been a fan of both Bitwarden for password security and email aliases for privacy, but I recently discovered a slick solution that combines the benefits of both.

The process involves connecting Bitwarden’s username generator with DuckDuckGo’s masked email service. While it’s a bit tricky to set up, it ultimately gives you an easy way to create unique emails and passwords on any app or website you visit, all in one place. Best of all, it’s free with no usage limitations.

title: Painting on the PC: The right accessories and best software
description:
If you haven’t tried your hand at painting yet due to lack of space, you can rest assured: You don’t necessarily need a canvas, brushes, and colors to express your artistic creativity. You can also paint with a (tablet) PC — and you don’t need half as much space. It’s also easier to get over failures and even correct them when painting digitally.

In this guide, we tell you everything you need for painting on a PC.

The necessary accessories: Tablet, pen, and software

If you have a notebook or a PC with a touch display, you can start painting straight away. Simply open any graphics program such as Paint or Paint.net and paint around on the display with your finger. The results will not be particularly artistic. B

title: This top-rated out-of-office assistant is under $50 for life
description:
For customer-facing workers, being out of the office can cost you time and money. With Snoooz, however, you’ll have an out-of-office assistant that will keep leads hot, relationships smooth, and even increase your productivity.

This intelligent AI assistant gives you a wide array of customizable autoresponder templates allowing you to tailor out-of-office replies to meet whatever a specific situation requires. From rescheduling meetings to creating coverage plans, to closing deals while you’re away, Snoooz lets you focus on your time

title: Share and store files seamlessly with Smmall Cloud — now $200 off
description:
Collaboration can be complicated when you’re working with a lot of files and versions. It’s easier, however, with Smmall Cloud — the focused, customizable, efficient file-sharing service that makes it as easy as dragging, dropping, and sharing files with your team and beyond.

Smmall Cloud supports any file type, from images and videos to Markdown docs, PDFs, audio, and more. On your profile page, you can easily promote what you’re working on, drive traffic to projects, and add your own custom branding.
